alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Essex; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 6:02PM EDT until April 06 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Richmond County in east central Virginia... Northeastern Caroline County in north central Virginia... Westmoreland County in east central Virginia... Northwestern Essex County in east central Virginia... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 601 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Port Royal, or 10 miles south of King George, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Loretto around 610 PM EDT. Leedstown around 615 PM EDT. Montross around 625 PM EDT. Coles Point around 640 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Lerty, Stratford Hall, Currioman Landing, Potomac Mills, Oak Grove, Supply, Singerly, Peeds, Erica and Foneswood. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
